amdegregorio.securerandomstring

Class SecureRandomString

  • java.lang.Object
    • amdegregorio.securerandomstring.SecureRandomString

  • public class SecureRandomString
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates a secure random alphanumeric string using java.util.SecureRandom.
    The default constructor sets the characters to be used to all upper and lower case letters and digits 0 through 9.
    Common Usage: 
       SecureRandomString secRndStr = new SecureRandomString();
   String generatedString = secRndStr.generateSecureRandomString(64);

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SecureRandomString()
      Creates a default SecureRandomString that creates a secure random string of alphanumeric characters.
      SecureRandomString(char[] allowedChars)
      Creates a SecureRandomString that generates a secure random string using the characters supplied.
      SecureRandomString(java.lang.String allowedCharsString)
      Creates a SecureRandomString that generates a secure random string using the string of characters supplied.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String generateSecureRandomString(int length)
      Generates a secure random string of the length provided using the array of allowed characters.

      • SecureRandomString

        public SecureRandomString(char[] allowedChars)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a SecureRandomString that generates a secure random string using the characters supplied.
        Parameters:
        allowedChars - an array of characters to use when generating the secure random string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided array is null or 0 length

      • SecureRandomString

        public SecureRandomString(java.lang.String allowedCharsString)

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided string is null or 0 length

    • Method Detail

      • generateSecureRandomString

        public java.lang.String generateSecureRandomString(int length)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generates a secure random string of the length provided using the array of allowed characters.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of secure string to generate.
        Returns:
        a secure random string of the length specified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length parameter is not a positive, non-zero string
